Title: Prove $\cos 20^\circ \cos 40^\circ \cos 80^\circ= \frac18$ geometrically
AcceptedAnswer:
Configure the relevant angles in the diagram and establish the followings \begin{align}
& \triangle ABE: \>\>\> \cos 20 = \frac{\frac y2}x = \frac y{2x}\\
& \triangle BGE: \>\>\> \cos 40 = \frac{\frac x2}1 = \frac x2\\
& \triangle ABC: \>\>\> \cos 80 = \frac{\frac12}y = \frac1{2y} \\
\end{align} which lead to $$\cos 20\cos 40 \cos 80 = \frac y{2x}\cdot\frac x2\cdot \frac1{2y} = \frac18$$
